class.name: CobbAPIBatchMoveRel
class.blurb: Functions for moving references in bulk, optionally with an offset relative to the target.

description.p: This API allows you to move references in bulk, optionally with local offsets.

To use the API, you call a function to create a BatchMoveRel task; this function returns a numeric "handle," which is like a ticket that you can exchange to access your task. Once you have a handle, you can use additional functions to configure your task, and then call a final function to run the task and receive results.
A task can only be configured or used by the same Papyrus call stack that created it; you can't pass a handle to some other part of your mod and operate on it later.

method.name: AddOperation

args.arg: The numeric handle for a BatchMoveRel task.
The reference to move.
The reference that akSubject should be moved to.

Three floats specifying an offset from akTarget's position. akSubject will be moved to the position of akTarget plus this offset. This argument is required, but if you don't want an offset, a quick shortcut is to pass new Float[3].
Three floats specifying an offset from akTarget's rotation, relative to akTarget's rotation. akSubject will be rotated to match.

method.blurb: Queues a reference to move to another reference.

args.arg: The numeric handle for a BatchMoveRel task.

A reference that exists in the same space (i.e. the same worldspace or cell) that akSubject should be moved to.
A world-relative position to move akSubject to.
A rotation to serve as a reference frame when applying position and rotation offsets.

Three floats specifying an offset from akTarget's position. akSubject will be moved to the position of akTarget plus this offset. This argument is required, but if you don't want an offset, a quick shortcut is to pass new Float[3].
Three floats specifying an offset from akTarget's rotation, relative to akTarget's rotation. akSubject will be rotated to match.

method.blurb: Queues a reference to move to a point in space.

example-data.comment:
This code moves kSubject 64 units below the target point, because we specify an offset 64 units above, but the target rotation is upside-down.
We're moving within the same cell, so the subject can be its own anchor.
example-data.raw: Float fTargetPos = new Float[3] Float fTargetRot = new Float[3] Float fOffsetPos = new Float[3] fTargetRot[0] = 180 fOffsetPos[2] = 64

method.name: AddOperationSpecial

args.arg: The numeric handle for a BatchMoveRel task.
The reference to move.
The reference that akSubject should be moved to.

Three floats specifying an offset from akTarget's position. akSubject will be moved to the position of akTarget plus this offset. This argument is required, but if you don't want an offset, a quick shortcut is to pass new Float[3].
Three floats specifying an offset from akTarget's rotation, relative to akTarget's rotation. akSubject will be rotated to match.

tr.td: A normal operation. The subject reference is moved to the target reference, with a position offset applied as appropriate.
If the subject reference is a load door, its destination door's teleport marker (so, the marker on the same side as the subject) is moved instead.
Your specified coordinates and target are ignored. The subject reference is moved back to its editor location.
We compute the offset from akSubject's editor location to akTarget's editor location, and move the subject in order to maintain that offset from the target's current position.

If the subject reference is a load door, then we compute the offset from its editor position to the editor position of its destination's teleport marker (so, the teleport marker on the same side as the subject). We then move the teleport marker to maintain that offset.

method.blurb: Queues a reference to move to another reference.

description.p: Queues a reference to move. The aiOperationType argument changes the behavior of this function.

method.blurb: Aborts a BatchMoveRel task, allowing its handle to be reused.

args.arg: The numeric handle for a BatchMoveRel task.

method.name: Create
method.blurb: Creates a BatchMoveRel task, and returns its numeric handle.

example-data.raw: CobbAPIBatchMove.AddOperation(iHandle, kRefToMove, kMoveTo, new Float[3], new Float[3])

method.name: Run
method.blurb: Executes a BatchMoveRel task and returns an array of the references that were successfully moved.

args.arg: The numeric handle for a BatchMoveRel task.

method.name: SetAlsoMoveTeleportMarkers

args.arg: The numeric handle for a BatchMoveRel task.

tr.td: The default. Do not modify load doors' teleport markers.
Move load doors' teleport markers in order to keep those markers in the same position relative to their doors.
Move load doors' teleport markers: compute the offset from the load door's editor position to the marker's editor position, and maintain that exact offset from the load door's new position.

method.blurb: Controls how a BatchMoveRel operation handles load doors' teleport markers.
